title: URLEscape with space char : "+" or "%20" ?
body:
by **christian.kakesa**: 
I'm working with a network services who needs encoded data. But I have 
problem with space character, when using "http.URLEscape" because GO 
tranform any space with "+" but not with "%20". The RFC3986 
(http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) says anything about that space must 
be encoded by "+". For now I'll tranform myself the "+" by
"%20".
Is it normal ? If so, why ?

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Use "http.URLEscape" with data contening space characters.

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
"http.URLEscape" must return "%20" with space char?

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?
$GOOS=linux
$GOARCH=386

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
0a2770db06ef tip

Please provide any additional information below.
